intro: Aiphanes leiospatha, commonly known as the smooth-leafed papyrus, is a member of the Cyperaceae family, native to southern Africa. It is a robust, clump-forming grass-like plant that typically grows in wetland or marshy environments. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves that are smooth and glabrous, giving it its common name. Its inflorescence consists of dense, cylindrical clusters of small, three-parted flowers. Aiphanes leiospatha is often used in restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soils and support wetland ecosystems.
